jobPostingInfo.title: Business Intelligence Market Research - Intern
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Description

The role of Agilent’s Business Intelligence Team is to work closely with the Agilent Commercial Marketing Team, across all markets and regions, to provide market and customer insights to characterize new markets, develop new products, support the development and execution of marketing strategy, and use internal and external data sources to inform business decisions.

We are looking for a Business Intelligence Market Research Intern to assist in supporting secondary market research efforts for our company. The role will involve gathering, analyzing, and presenting data related to our customers, competitors, and markets of focus. You will work closely with the business intelligence and research teams to help capture insights that drive informed decision-making.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Secondary Market Research: Assist in collecting and analyzing secondary data from various sources, such as market reports, industry publications, public databases, and digital resources.

  • Competitor Analysis: Research competitors within the industry to evaluate their strategies, strengths, weaknesses, and market positioning.

  • Customer Insights: Support efforts to gather and evaluate data related to customer behavior, trends, and demographics.

  • Data Analysis & Reporting: Analyze large datasets and present findings in clear, concise reports and visualizations.

  • Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams (e.g., marketing, sales, strategy) to ensure insights are integrated into business strategies.

  • Ad Hoc Research Tasks: Assist with any additional research projects or analysis requests from other teams as needed.

  • Database Management: Support the maintenance of repositories to store gathered research and insights.

Qualifications

  • Actively pursuing or completed a bachelor's or graduate degree in a related field of science in a recognized academic institution in the USA with graduation sometime after May 2026.

  • Chemistry (analytical/Forensics), Biology (Biotechnology/Molecular Biology), Environmental Science ( Environmental Chemistry/Toxicology, Pharmacology ( Pharmaceutical Sciences, Clinical Chemistry), Food Chemistry, Clinical/Medical Science, Geochemistry

  • Actively pursuing a Master's or PhD in data analytics or an MBA degree would be a plus

  • Ability to summarize complex information into clear, concise, and engaging content.

  • Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel); familiarity with social media platforms and content management tools.

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, with attention to detail.

  • Ability to work independently while collaborating with cross-functional teams.

  • Ability to work between 15-20 hours per week while pursuing a degree.

  • Knowledge of industry trends and current events in the Life Sciences Industry would be a plus.

  • Previous market research experience through courses, projects, or internships would be a plus.

  • Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) or infographic design would be a plus.

Location: Ability to work one to two days per week from our Santa Clara, CA office is required.

Learning & Development Opportunities:

  • Gain hands-on experience in data analysis, market research, and business intelligence.

  • Exposure to real-world business intelligence tools and platforms.

  • Mentorship from senior analysts and exposure to key company strategies and decision-making processes.

  • Opportunities for professional growth and networking.

The intern pay rate for this position is $24 - $36/hour plus eligibility for paid holidays and medical benefits. Our pay ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. During the hiring process, a recruiter can share more about the specific pay range for a preferred location. 
 

Additional Details

This job has a part time weekly schedule. It includes the option to work remotely. Applications for this job will be accepted until at least April 3, 2025 or until the job is no longer posted.

Agilent Technologies, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We value diversity at all levels. All individuals, regardless of personal characteristics, are encouraged to apply. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, pregnancy, race, religion or religious creed, color, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, registered domestic partner status, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state, local law, ordinance, or regulation and will not be discriminated against on these bases. jobPostingInfo.title: Field Service Engineer in Madrid (Atomic/Molecular) or Sevilla (LC/MS)- Graduate Position
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Description

Agilent inspires and supports discoveries that advance the quality of life. We provide life science, diagnostic and applied market laboratories worldwide with instruments, services, consumables, applications and expertise. Agilent enables customers to gain the answers and insights they seek, so they can do what they do best: improve the world around us. Information about Agilent is available at www.agilent.com.

Every day, Agilent Customer Support Engineers help our customers to solve issues that enable scientists to make discoveries that improve the quality of life. Through our work, we deliver insights and provide support that keep labs running smoothly and more efficiently. The ability to help with solving customer problems and a commitment to deliver the highest levels of customer service is how you will build customer success.

Your Role:

As a Field Service Engineer for Agilent in Spain, you will work at a variety of labs supporting our clients with on-site delivering of installation, maintenance, application, software and compliance services as well as customer training on our Spectroscopy (Atomic and Molecular) portfolio in case of you are interested in Madrid area or Liquid Chromatography (LC/LCMS) portfolio if your preferred location is Sevilla area. In that sense, having an appetite for continuously learning about new instruments, software and analytical method consulting is key. So your communication skills, creativity and can-do attitude is essential on top of the technical knoledge.

Your main responsibilities include:

  • Installs and optimizes hardware/software/network products and configurations as well as implements analytical method workflow solutions at customer sites.
  • Diagnoses and resolves product and application method performance problems.
  • Performs maintenance, compliance verification and hardware & software customer training delivery.
  • Ensures customer satisfaction by advising customers on preventive maintenance and configurations, which may impact product performance.
  • Addresses customer requests for service and communicate proactively before, during and after service.
  • Collaborates with Agilent teams such as Support, Sales, Marketing and R&D to provide solutions to customers.
  • May deliver internal technical trainings, seminars and workshops for field engineers.

For this job, you must consent to participate and meet Agilent approved customer/vendor credentialing requirements necessary to gain access to customer sites where you will be working.

Qualifications

Qualifications

  • A completed university degree within the last 24 months in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Biotechnology or similar.
  • Post-graduate, certification, and/or license may be required.
  • Experience with computer/software/server connected equipment.
  • 2/3 years of experience in method application development with equipment such as ICPMS, ICPOES for Madrid location or Chromatography equipment such as HLPC-QQQ, HPLC-QTOF for Sevilla area is a plus.
  • You will need to be proactive and self-driven, as well as having curiosity and willingness to learn new products/ services.
  • Strong soft skills capabilities for this customer facing role is mandatory.
  • Full proficient of Spanish and high level of English.
  • Driver's license

We offer:

This full-time, permanent position, based in Spain, is available as soon as possible. The role won’t be head-office based, but working remotely combined with the short/medium-distance travel to customer sites within your assigned geography area (a company car will be available to you).

We will make sure you get all the training and development opportunities you need to become the best in your field, including learning about new hw, sw, application methods and workflows in Agilent’s state of the art demo facility.

Outstanding company culture and career development opportunities in a position within an international organization, offering a dynamic working environment, with exciting challenges.

Company pension scheme, yearly company bonus, company car, private health care, stock purchase plan, medical & life insurance etc. are included in the benefit package.

jobPostingInfo.title: Social Media Coordinator - 12-month Industrial Placement
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Description

About the Role: We are seeking a Social Media Coordination Intern to join our dynamic and international social media team. This role is ideal for someone with strong business and analytical skills to apply in the digital marketing space, rather than a focus on editing or creative arts.

You will support the optimization, organization, and management of the Agilent YouTube channel and other social profiles, contributing to our overall marketing objectives. This internship offers a unique opportunity to learn from top experts, collaborate with a diverse team, and build your career in a supportive environment where innovation and collaboration are key.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with the Social Media team to analyze user-centric data and reconsider the channel structure, including playlists, by identifying relevant keywords and search patterns.
  • Review and update video playlists to ensure they are current and meet our audience's needs.
  • Assist with quality control of content and implementation of best practices for social media.
  • Improve discoverability by recommending optimizations for video titles, descriptions, and tags in alignment with YouTube’s algorithm.
  • Help increase content appeal to enhance search visibility on YouTube.
  • Partner with the Social Media Team and stakeholders to oversee community engagement, managing questions and conversations.
  • Apply key SEO principles to ensure content is easily findable.
  • Recommend video structures to enhance viewer engagement.
  • Establish and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders across global teams and regions.

Qualifications

As this is a 12-month placement position, you need to be enrolled at a university, preferably in Marketing, Digital Marketing, Science Communication, or Business Studies, and will be returning to that same course upon completion of the internship.
 

Qualifications:

  • Currently enrolled in a university program, preferably in Marketing, Digital Marketing, Science Communication, or Business Studies, and usually returning to the same course upon completion of the internship.
  • Experience with Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel is required
  • Some experience or knowledge of YouTube is essential; experience with YouTube Shorts, Instagram Reels, or TikTok is a plus.
  • Basic knowledge of SEO and SEM principles is advantageous.

Skills and Attributes:

  • Passion for marketing with a deep interest in social media and YouTube.
  • Strong project management and organizational skills.
  • Experience or demonstrated interest in social media marketing and content creation.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills, capable of effective collaboration within a team.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects, adapt to interruptions, and remain flexible with changing tasks.
  • Demonstrates autonomy and teamwork, with excellent communication skills for engaging with diverse internal and external stakeholders.

Educational Background:

  • Preferred: Marketing, Digital Marketing, Science Communication, or Business Studies.

This role is office-based at our state-of-the-art facility in Harwell (UK) or Barcelona (Spain). Upon successful completion of the onboarding period, the candidate will have the option to work in a hybrid model, working from home remotely one or two days per week.

jobPostingInfo.title: Graduate Field Service Engineer – GC/GCMS – Emilia-Romagna
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Description

Agilent is a global leader in laboratory and clinical technologies; we are passionate about bringing great science to life.  Our commitment to quality and innovation supports cutting-edge life science research, patient diagnostics, and ensures the safety of water, food, and pharmaceuticals. As scientists and clinicians pursue small, everyday advances and life-changing discoveries, we provide trusted answers to their most critical questions and challenges. We can’t wait for you to join us as we continue our mission to improve the world around us.  Information about Agilent is available at www.agilent.com. 

Every day, Agilent Field Service Engineers help our customers to solve issues that enable scientists to make discoveries that enhance the quality of life. Through our work, we deliver insights and provide support that keep laboratories running smoothly and more efficiently. Join our dynamic organization to be a part of this rewarding and exciting work!

You will be responsible for supporting our clients with on-site installation, implementation, maintenance and delivery of customer training on our gas chromatography coupled with mass spectrometry (GC/GCMS).

Your main responsibilities will be: 

•    Respond to customer needs by providing repair, installation, upgrade and preventive maintenance activities
•    Contact customers in a timely manner and schedules service efficiently
•    Connect with manager and sales team to understand and meet customer needs and expectations

jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Description

Agilent inspires and supports discoveries that advance the quality of life. We provide life science, diagnostic and applied market laboratories worldwide with instruments, services, consumables, applications and expertise. Agilent enables customers to gain the answers and insights they seek ---- so they can do what they do best: improve the world around us. Information about Agilent is available at www.agilent.com.

 

 

As a Field Service Engineer for Agilent, you will work at a variety of labs, so having an appetite for continuously learning about new instruments, software and consumables is key. Applying your communication skills, creativity and can-do attitude is essential. The ability to help with solving customer problems and a commitment to deliver the highest-levels of customer service is how you will build customer success.

 

Your Role:

You will be responsible for supporting our customers with on-site installation, implementation, maintenance and repair of company and multi-vendor systems solutions. Our varied product lines include hardware, software and networking products as well as operating systems.

  • Installs and optimizes hardware/software/network products and configurations at customer sites.
  • Diagnoses and resolves product performance problems.
  • Performs maintenance and repairs
  • Ensures customer satisfaction by advising customers on preventive maintenance and configurations, which may impact product performance.
  • Proactively responds to potential equipment issues to prevent unplanned interruption of customers' business.
  • Deliver fully integrated solutions, which may include peripherals, communications, operating systems and applications software.
  • Train other field engineers and customers in the solutions

Qualifications

Your Qualifications:

  • Degree within the science field -- e.g. chemistry, analytical chemistry.
  • Master or Phd is desired but not essential.
  • Experience or expertise Chromatography or Mass spectrometry (LC/ GC, LCMS , GCMS ).
  • Experience with the Agilent solutions is desired but not essential.
  • You enjoy travelling and visiting customers.
  • Spanish speaker is a must and good level of English

 Apart from these more technical skills, you should also have:

  • excellent communication (and with it, potential customer service) skills,
  • a logical approach to problem-solving,
  • the ability to organize and prioritize your workload effectively,
  • a strong valuation of processes and the ability to follow them accordingly with strong attention to detail, with the final aim to ensure compliance with Agilent's Quality standards,
  • the ability to set customer expectations and balance customer requirements with Agilent's business needs,
  • the ability to both work independent as well as within teams..

jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Description

Are you a recent PhD-graduate or postdoctoral researcher, wanting to apply all the knowledge and skills acquired in academia to a role in industry, building your career in our pioneering and solutions-driven environment?

By joining our Talent Pool for PhD-graduates in Denmark, our recruiters will have access to your application in case a position matching your profile opens in the future. A PhD-degree and scientific background is particularly interesting for roles in the following functional areas:

  • Research & Development

  • Quality & Regulatory

  • Manufacturing

  • Sales and Marketing

Important: Please note that signing up for this talent pool  does not replace an application for a currently existing/ open role – therefore, please make sure to have checked our career site for current opportunities in Denmark, Europe, and globally: www.agilent.com/go/careers.

Qualifications

Note that this talent pool is particularly addressing PhD-graduate talent, currently studying, or having graduated recently, as well as postdoctoral researchers looking for their next career step in industry. Experienced professionals: please check our career site for current openings.

Remember that in case you would identify a specific role of your interest on our Job Portal, please apply specifically for that role.

No specific requirements can be indicated for this PhD-Graduate Talent pool, but note that:

  • Your PhD-degree should ideally be in a Sciences-, Engineering-, or Technology--related field.

jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Description

Du möchtest aktiv mit anpacken und nicht nur im Büro sitzen? 

Dann ist diese Ausbildung genau das Richtige für dich!

Was dich erwartet:

Zusammen mit unserem Logistik-Team kontrollierst du Wareneingänge, kommissionierst und koordinierst Kundenbestellungen. An der Berufsschule lernst du Logistikmanagement sowie rechtliche Grundlagen zu Gefahrgütern, Zollgut und chemischen Artikeln.

Mit Unterstützung deiner Kollegen wirst du unsere zentralen und dezentralen Logistikstandorte wie deine Westentasche kennenlernen. Außerdem erhältst du spannende Einblicke in andere Bereiche wie Einkauf und Produktion.

Qualifications

Das bringst du mit:

  • Einen sehr guten Hauptschulabschluss oder einen höheren Abschluss

  • Den Wunsch, aktiv mit Tatendrang mitzuarbeiten und keinen reinen Bürojob zu haben

  • Organisationstalent, Gewissenhaftigkeit und Zuverlässigkeit – du bist ein echter Macher mit Anpackermentalität

  • Die Fähigkeit, gut im Team zu arbeiten und Alleingänge sind nicht so dein Ding

Warum Agilent?

  • Sehr gute Ausbildungsvergütung, zusätzlich mehrmalige Sonderzahlungen, 30 Urlaubstage, zusätzliche Freizeit durch ein flexibles Arbeitszeitmodell.

  • Spannende und abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben in einem dynamischen Umfeld

  • Vielfältige Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten nach der Ausbildung

Mehr über Agilent Deutschland erfährst Du hier: https://careers.agilent.com/locations/europe/germany/

Dann komm in unser Team und starte deine Karriere in der Logistik!

jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Description

Agilent inspire et soutient les découvertes qui font progresser la qualité de vie. Nous fournissons aux laboratoires des sciences de la vie, du diagnostic et du marché appliqué dans le monde entier des instruments, des services, des consommables, des applications et une expertise. Agilent permet aux clients d’obtenir les réponses et les informations qu’ils recherchent - afin qu’ils puissent faire ce qu’ils font le mieux : améliorer le monde qui nous entoure. Des informations sur Agilent sont disponibles sur agilent.com.


En tant qu'Apprenti(e) Technico-Commercial(e), vous serez en charge du développement de l’activité de nos solutions et instruments de chromatographie et spectroscopie (LC, GC, GC-MS, ICP-MS, UV, etc…) auprès de clients existants et de nouveaux prospects en France.


Vos principales missions seront les suivantes :


• Répondre aux demandes clients (demandes de devis, d'échantillons, d'informations, appels d’offre, etc..)
• Assurer la gestion, relance et renouvellement des affaires/offres en cours
• Engager des campagnes de prospection par téléphone/email ou sur les réseaux sociaux
• Créer et mettre à jour les outils informatiques d'aide à la vente
• Mettre à jour la base de données CRM
• Soutenir les responsables de secteur terrain pour des actions de prospection ciblées ou le suivi clients
• Assurer la satisfaction client

Cet apprentissage d’un an minimum est à pourvoir idéalement pour début septembre 2025.

Qualifications

Nous recherchons des personnes motivées avec le background suivant :
• Titulaire au minimum d’une Licence en Chimie Analytique ou proche (Chimie, Biochimie, Biotechnologies, Biologie, etc…) et admissible en Master 1 ou Master 2
• Connaissances des méthodes analytiques en chromatographie et/ou spectroscopie (LC, GC, GC-MS, ICP-MS, UV, etc…)
• Maîtrise du pack Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
• Anglais lu, parlé et écrit


Sur le plan personnel, vous êtes proactif(ve), dynamique et autonome. Vous êtes également une/un très bon(ne) communiquant(e) et vous aimez le travail en équipe.

jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Description


Responsible for supporting customers through on-site activities such as installation, implementation, maintenance and repair of company and multi-vendor systems solutions which may include hardware, software and networking products as well as operating systems.

Installs and optimizes hardware/software/network products and configurations at customer sites.

Diagnoses and resolves product performance problems.

Performs maintenance and repair services.

Ensures customer satisfaction by advising customers on preventive maintenance and configurations, which may impact product performance.

Proactively responds to potential equipment or software issues to prevent unplanned interruption of customers' business.

Delivers (does not design) fully integrated solutions, which may include peripherals, communications, operating systems and applications software.

Serves as an internal resource on technical issues and manages product escalations Collaborates with Agilent teams such as Support, Sales, Marketing and R&D to provide solutions to customers.

May have knowledge of third-party products.

May deliver internal technical training and maintenance seminars and workshops for field engineers or customers.

May train other field engineers or customers.

May calibrate equipment on-site for large volume customers.

May qualify leads.

Must consent to participate and meet Agilent approved customer/vendor credentialing requirements necessary to gain access to customer sites.

Requirements may include, but are not limited to, proof of identification, proof of certification to perform the work required, customer health and safety requirements, etc.

Bachelor's or Master's Degree or equivalent.

Post-graduate, certification, and/or license may be required.

Generally, requires minimal to no prior relevant work experience.

jobPostingInfo.title: Graduate Customer Support Engineer – Biomolecular Solutions
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Description

Agilent is a global leader in laboratory and clinical technologies; we are passionate about bringing great science to life.  Our commitment to quality and innovation supports cutting-edge life science research, patient diagnostics, and ensures the safety of water, food, and pharmaceuticals. As scientists and clinicians pursue small, everyday advances and life-changing discoveries, we provide trusted answers to their most critical questions and challenges. We can’t wait for you to join us as we continue our mission to improve the world around us.  Information about Agilent is available at www.agilent.com.

Every day, Agilent Customer Support Engineers help our customers to solve issues that enable scientists to make discoveries that enhance the quality of life. Through our work, we deliver insights and provide support that keep laboratories running smoothly and more efficiently. Join our dynamic organization to be a part of this rewarding and exciting work!

You will be responsible for supporting our clients with on-site installation, implementation, maintenance and delivery of customer training on our Biomolecular Services (Automation, Genomics and Cell Analysis).

Your main responsibilities will be: 

  • Respond to customer needs by providing repair, installation, upgrade and preventive maintenance activities
  • Contact customers in a timely manner and schedule services efficiently
  • Connect with manager and sales team to understand and meet customer needs and expectations
  • Maintain Agilent’s customer service reputation by aligning with all corporate policies and procedures
  • Complete administrative paperwork and computer reports promptly and accurately
  • Provide feedback to the Product Specialists, manufacturing or OEM vendors concerning performance anomalies encountered - use the complaint handling system as required 
  • Address customer requests for service and communicate proactively before, during and after service

For this role, you will be working remotely combined with travel to customers primarily in the area from Leeds to Manchester, but with occasional travel further in UK when required (with occasional nights away).

Qualifications

We are looking for an individual with the following background:

  • A recent university degree in a Life Sciences related field (Molecular Biology, Biochemistry, Biotechnology, etc.)
  • At least a first hands-on experience (internship/placement, university project or first position) preferably in a lab with biology techniques (PCR, Gel Electrophoresis, Flow Cytometry, Spectroscopy)
  • Full proficiency in English
  • A valid driving license

On a personal level, you are proactive, outgoing and customer oriented. You enjoy working both autonomously and as part of a team, to solve various types of problems. You have great communications and interpersonal skills to interact with many internal and external partners. 

What we offer:

  • Permanent Contract in an international organization, offering a dynamic working environment, with exciting challenges and opportunities
  • Competitive compensation and benefits package (company car, yearly company bonus, private health care, pension scheme, discounted stock purchase plan, medical & life insurance…)
  • Outstanding company culture
  • Career development opportunities

We will make sure you get all the training and development opportunities you need to become the best in your field.

jobPostingInfo.title: Chromatography Sales Intern
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Description

Are you pursuing a degree in the sciences and interested in applying it to a sales career? Join the Inside Laboratory Solutions Sales Organization at Agilent, a leader in the life sciences, diagnostics, and applied chemical markets. As an intern with our inside sales team, you will leverage your passion for science to support the inside sales organization while also participating in outbound demand generation campaigns.

You will rotate between supporting our Instrument Inside Sales Team and our Columns and Supplies Inside Sales Team. Your time will be divided between inbound and outbound activities, providing you with a well-rounded experience in sales operations.

Responsibilities:

  • Answering inbound customer phone calls, qualifying the lead, and entering for sales rep follow up

  • Triaging customer requests through email

  • Generating quotations for sales reps

  • Updating data in our sales system

  • Inviting customers to local trade shows and events

  • Outbound demand generation campaigns

  • Learn Agilent’s workflow solutions and Agilent’s expansive portfolio (GC, GC-MS, LC, LC-MS, UV-Vis, FT-IR, ICP-MS, ICP-OES, AA, MP-AES, Consumables, Services, Software, etc.)

Interns are expected to work 40 hours/week throughout the summer and continue to work part time throughout the school year. Flexible hours are available, with a preference of 15-20 hours a week.

Qualifications

  • Completion of sophomore or junior year towards a BA/BS in Chemistry, Biochemistry, or related science degree.

  • Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office - Excel, Word, Outlook

  • Strong interest in interacting directly with customers (via phone, email)

  • Excellent verbal, written and phone communications skills.

  • Strong professional demeanor, as well as business acumen required.

  • Must be a team player with ability to work in a fast paced, dynamic team environment.

jobPostingInfo.title: Duales Studium Informatik / Medizinische Informatik (m/f/d)
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Description

Ideenzünder/in + Knobelkönig/in + Um-die-Ecke-Denker/in = Softwareentwickler/in bei Agilent

Geht diese Gleichung für dich auf? Dann bewirb dich jetzt für ein duales Studium bei Agilent! Bei uns hast du die Möglichkeit, von Anfang an eigenverantwortlich an Projekten mitzuwirken und deine Stärken und Interessen sinnvoll einzubringen.

Was dich erwartet:

Während du dir in den Vorlesungsphasen an der DHBW Karlsruhe theoretisches Informatik-Wissen und – beim Studiengang Medizinische Informatik – auch medizinische Grundkenntnisse aneignest, wirst du in den Praxisphasen in verschiedenen Fachbereichen eingesetzt. So bekommst du einen umfassenden Überblick über unsere Forschungs- und Entwicklungsabteilung.

Möchtest du lieber an der Hochschule Karlsruhe studieren und trotzdem von Anfang an praktische Erfahrungen sammeln? Dann kannst du bei uns auch Informatik im „StudiumPLUS Praxis“ Modell in Kooperation mit der Hochschule Karlsruhe studieren. Beim persönlichen Kennenlernen erarbeiten wir gemeinsam das passende Studienmodell (DHBW oder Hochschule Karlsruhe) für dich.

Ob in der Soft- oder Firmwareentwicklung, beim Testing unserer Produkte wie Flüssigkeitschromatographen oder Massenspektrometer, oder in der produktionsnahen Entwicklungsumgebung – dir bieten sich während deines Studiums und auch danach spannende Einsatzmöglichkeiten und vielfältige Perspektiven.

Bei der Auswahl deiner Projekte in den Praxisphasen entscheidest du mit. Das Ergebnis deiner Projekte wird mit Spannung erwartet, weil es tatsächlich zum Einsatz kommt und nicht nur zu Übungszwecken programmiert wird. Du hast über die gesamte Studienzeit einen Mentor oder eine Mentorin, der/die dich betreut und immer für dich da ist.

Qualifications

Das bringst du mit:

  • Ein gutes Abitur, wobei Mathematik und Naturwissenschaften zu deinen Lieblingsfächern zählen

  • Die Fähigkeit, selbstständig zu arbeiten und trotzdem ein Teamplayer zu sein

  • Gute Englischkenntnisse

  • Strukturierte Arbeitsweise und die Fähigkeit, komplexe Zusammenhänge zu erkennen und zu analysieren

  • Erste Programmierkenntnisse

Warum Agilent?

  • Sehr gute Vergütung, zusätzlich mehrmalige Sonderzahlungen, 30 Urlaubstage, zusätzliche Freizeit durch ein flexibles Arbeitszeitmodell.

jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Description

Agilent encourages and supports discoveries that advance the quality of life. We provide life science, diagnostic, and applied market laboratories worldwide with instruments, services, consumables, applications, and expertise. Agilent enables customers to gain the answers and insights they seek -- so they can do what they do best: improve the world around us. Want more information on Agilent? Check out www.agilent.com!

We are looking for an enthusiastic Intern to join our European Back Office Sales Operations Support team. This role offers a fantastic opportunity to gain hands-on experience in sales operations, tender management, and data analysis while working closely with various departments. Typical Tasks and Responsibilities of the European Back Office Sales Operations Support team include, but are not limited to:

  • Tender Management: Researching, evaluating, and preparing tender documents in alignment with Agilent’s sales strategy.
  • Documentation Management: Preparing and handling administrative, technical, and economic documentation for tenders.
  • Collaboration: Working with Sales Account Managers and other partners to develop tender response strategies and create bid packages.
  • Data and CRM Management: Leading data and CRM updates, creating analyses using tools like Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.
  • Forecasting and Vendor Evaluation: Enabling more accurate forecasting capabilities and evaluating third-party services and solutions.
  • Data Communication: Extracting and elaborating data related to service parameters and communicating findings to different partners.
  • Administrative and Project Support: Participating in various administrative and project management tasks.

Intern Responsibilities:

  • Support the team in the above tasks and responsibilities.
  • Assist in the preparation and management of tender documents and other administrative tasks.
  • Collaborate with team members to develop tender response strategies and create bid packages.
  • Help manage data and CRM updates and create analyses using Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.
  • Assist in enabling more accurate forecasting capabilities and evaluating third-party services and solutions.
  • Regularly extract and elaborate data related to service parameters and communicate findings to different partners.
  • Participate in various administrative and project management tasks based on your experience and interests.

Qualifications

  • Currently pursuing a bachelor’s/master’s degree in Business Administration, Economics, Life Sciences, or a related field.
  • Proficiency in English; knowledge of German (for students applying out of Germany and/ or the Germany-based opportunity).
  • Skilled in Microsoft Office; familiarity with Power Bi is beneficial but not required.
  • Strong communication skills and a willingness to learn.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

This is a full-time internship/placement position, targeting a duration of 12 months (requirement for UK-based internship position).

This position can be based at our Cheadle (Manchester area, UK) or Waldbronn (Karlsruhe area, Germany) office.

jobPostingInfo.title: Graduate Customer Support Engineer – Chromatography
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Description

Agilent is a global leader in laboratory and clinical technologies; we are passionate about bringing great science to life.  Our commitment to quality and innovation supports cutting-edge life science research, patient diagnostics, and ensures the safety of water, food, and pharmaceuticals. As scientists and clinicians pursue small, everyday advances and life-changing discoveries, we provide trusted answers to their most critical questions and challenges. We can’t wait for you to join us as we continue our mission to improve the world around us.  Information about Agilent is available at www.agilent.com.

Every day, Agilent Customer Support Engineers help our customers to solve issues that enable scientists to make discoveries that enhance the quality of life. Through our work, we deliver insights and provide support that keep laboratories running smoothly and more efficiently. Join our dynamic organization to be a part of this rewarding and exciting work!

You will be responsible for supporting our clients with on-site installation, implementation, maintenance and delivery of customer training on our chromatography solutions (LC, LC/MS, GC, GC/MS, HPLC).

Your main responsibilities will be: 

  • Respond to customer needs by providing repair, installation, upgrade and preventive maintenance activities
  • Contact customers in a timely manner and schedules service efficiently
  • Connect with manager and sales team to understand and meet customer needs and expectations
  • Maintain Agilent’s customer service reputation by aligning with all corporate policies and procedures
  • Complete administrative paperwork and computer reports promptly and accurately
  • Provide feedback to the Product Specialists, manufacturing or OEM vendors concerning performance anomalies encountered - use the complaint handling system as required 
  • Address customer requests for service and communicate proactively before, during and after service

For this role, you will be working remotely combined with travel to customer sites (4-5 days per week, with occasional nights away) in the Cambridge / North London area (a company car will be available to you). 

Qualifications

We are looking for an individual with the following background:

  • A recent university degree in a Chemistry related field (Analytical Chemistry, Biochemistry, Biotechnology, etc…)
  • At least a first hands-on experience (internship/placement, university project or first position) with chromatography solutions (LC, LC/MS, GC, GC/MS, HPLC)   
  • Full proficiency in English
  • A valid driving license

On a personal level, you are proactive, outgoing and customer oriented. You enjoy working both autonomously and as part of a team, to solve various types of problems. You have great communications and interpersonal skills to interact with many internal and external partners. 

What we offer:

  • Permanent Contract
  • Outstanding company culture
  • Career development opportunities
  • Company pension scheme, yearly company bonus, company car, private health care, stock purchase plan, medical & life insurance…
  • A position within an international organisation, offering a dynamic working environment, with exciting challenges and opportunities

We will make sure you get all the training and development opportunities you need to become the best in your field.

jobPostingInfo.title: Graduate Instrument Sales Account Manager – Ireland
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Description

Agilent encourages and supports discoveries that advance the quality of life. We provide life science, diagnostic, and applied market laboratories worldwide with instruments, services, consumables, applications, and expertise. Agilent enables customers to gain the answers and insights they seek -- so they can do what they do best: improve the world around us. Want more information on Agilent? Check out www.agilent.com!

Do you have commercial expertise to sell technical solutions and are you looking to kick start your sales career? If so, you might be the person that we are looking for!

We are currently looking for a Graduate Instrument Sales Account Manager – preferably based in the Cork area (South Ireland) - to join our industry leading instrument sales team, part of the Agilent Technologies Ireland team. In this dynamic role, you will be supporting the instrument sales team initially to gain sales experience and promoting and selling analytical instruments to assigned accounts in the South-East area of Ireland.

Initially, in addition to managing a territory in the field, you will support the instrument sales team to ensure you gain a strong understanding of the internal systems and sales processes. Working closely with competitive and successful sales professionals, to support your development and success. You will be responsible for maintaining and growing market share across the Agilent product portfolio (chromatography, mass spectrometry and spectroscopy instrumentation) to reach your financial targets.

This is a highly independent role in an international team, where you will be responsible for:

  • Acquiring new customers, while maintaining and growing the existing installed base
  • Consistently monitoring the customer experience and strengthening the customer relationship
  • Supporting the field sales team to help execute on the country sales strategy
  • Creatively tailoring solutions to meet customer requirements with close support from Product Specialists and Application Engineers
  • Work collaboratively across
  • Driving account and territory strategic plans for growth

In this critical sales role, you will utilise your demonstrated commercial expertise to sell solutions consultatively. You will collaborate closely across all Agilent channels: CSD (Consumables), CSO (Service Delivery), SSD (Service Sales) and COPC (Customer Operations Center).

Qualifications

  • B.S., M.S. or Ph.D. degree in Biology, Chemistry, other applied field or equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Working understanding of Chromatography, Mass Spectrometry and Spectroscopy instruments as it pertains to an analytical lab
  • Some sales experience in either Agilent's markets, or in another sales environment preferable
  • Fluent in English
  • Clean full driving license

What will make you stand out: 

  • The ability to negotiate and mitigate critical customer issues
  • Ability to interface at all levels within an organization for both internal/external customers
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills as well as interpersonal and presentation skills
  • Teaming/collaboration skills (resource management and team leadership)
  • Knowledge of the Pharmaceutical, Biopharma and Chemical Analysis industry would be a valued asset
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel, including pivot tables and macros 
  • Perfect networking abilities to integrate customer priorities and influence key stakeholders

What we offer

  • A permanent position in an international and multifaced workplace with exciting challenges and opportunities. You will become part of a company with very high ethics, values and business standards.
  • Outstanding company culture
  • Career development opportunities
  • Company pension scheme, yearly company bonus, private health care, medical & life insurance, company car or car allowance…

You will become part of a company that works according to these values:
We move life sciences and diagnostics forward, care about the needs of our customers and strive to ensure people are treated consistently, fairly and with respect. We deliver effective life science and diagnostic solutions valued by our customers.

We will make sure you get all the training and development opportunities you need to become the best in your field!

Every day, Agilent Service Engineers help our customers in Northern Spain to solve issues that enable scientists to make discoveries that improve the quality of life. Through our work, we deliver insights and provide support that keep labs running smoothly and more efficiently.

As a Field Service Engineer for Agilent, you will work at a variety of labs, so having an appetite for continuously learning about new instruments, software and consumables is key. Applying your communication skills, creativity and can-do attitude is essential. The ability to help with solving customer problems and a commitment to deliver the highest-levels of customer service is how you will build customer success.

This role entails providing not only technical but also application support to our customers and colleagues. Work on-site at a variety of labs and support the customers with instruments:

  • Works on assignments with general outline and broad objectives in increasing area of responsibility.
  • Work is done independently within general framework and reviewed for accuracy as needed.
  • Expected to operate and perform successfully with less supervision.
  • Broad scope and influence within team to identify and recommend process or program improvements and solutions to increasingly complex challenges.
  • Determines appropriate methods, actions and approaches to assignments, with occasional support from team leads, experts, and management as needed.
  • Contributes actively in team activities, sharing expertise and ideas and developing leadership skills.
  • Collaborates internally or externally on projects in area of specialization.
  • May assist in mentoring or training others using increased knowledge and experience.

Qualifications

  • University degree in Biology, Molecular Biology, Biotechnology or BioPharma
  • Minimum hands-on experience with biomolecular, genomics and/or automation solutions, either as an end-user OR in a similar technical support role is preferred
  • Full proficiency in Spanish and at least good level of English
  • A valid driving license

The role won’t be head-office based, but working remotely combined with the short-distance travel to customer sites within your assigned geography in this case Catalonia and Aragon (a company car will be available to you).
